item.title: Two Out of Three Americans (67.1 percent) Would Rather Spend the Holidays with Extended Family than at a Resort with a Partner or Friends, Says TD Bank Survey
item.description: [PR Newswire] - CHERRY HILL, N.J., Dec. 20, 2016 /PRNewswire/ -- More than two-thirds of Americans believe there's no place like home for the holidays – with 67.1 percent of those surveyed stating that they'd rather spend the holidays with extended family than at a resort with a partner or close friends (32.9 percent), according to the 2016 TD Bank Holiday Giving Report, which surveyed 1,502 U.S. respondents aged 18 to 65+ via Google Surveys. In fact, only around one third of respondents (36.3 percent) said they don't engage in any form of charity during the holidays. "I find it heartwarming to see how many Americans believe in giving back to those in need," said Michael Carbone, Regional President, TD Bank.

item.title: TD Economics: Cloudy, With a Chance of Fireballs
item.description: [PR Newswire] - CHERRY HILL, N.J., Dec. 15, 2016 /PRNewswire/ -- The American economy is back on track, but, with new leadership in Washington, the band of uncertainty around the forecasts has widened, according to a new report by TD Economics (www.td.com/economics), an affiliate of TD Bank, America's Most Convenient Bank®. "A lot has changed over the past three months, even as the economy has advanced in line with our expectations," says TD Bank's Chief Economist, Beata Caranci.

Red means stop! Banking app cuts customer spending
item.description: [Reuters] - Toronto-Dominion Bank did not set out to change consumer habits when it offered its TD MySpend app in April. Canada’s second-largest bank just wanted to offer more information to customers who use their phones to check account balances. "The real-time nature encourages customers to change their behavior toward their financial goals," Rizwan Khalfan, chief digital officer at TD Bank, told Reuters in his first interview about customers using the app.

item.title: TD opens new branch in Richmond at Central Garden City shopping complex
item.description: [CNW Group] - TD opens new branch in Richmond at Central Garden City shopping complex

item.title: TD opens new branch in Richmond at Central Garden City shopping complex
item.description: [PR Newswire] - RICHMOND, BC, Dec. 10, 2016 /CNW/ - Today, TD officially opened its ninth branch in Richmond located at Unit 1505 - 4777 McClelland Road in the new Central at Garden City shopping centre. As one of Richmond's newest shopping destinations and growing communities, Central now has the added convenience of a full-service TD branch to complete the shopping experience. The new shopping complex, bordered by Alderbridge Way, Garden City Road and Alexandra Road, is an impressive destination and is a one-stop-shop for a variety of stores and services.

item.title: Electronic Payments and Invoicing Increase Finance Professionals' Concerns about Cybersecurity and Fraud
item.description: [PR Newswire] - CHERRY HILL, N.J., Dec. 5, 2016 /PRNewswire/ -- As every facet of the financial services industry faces the imminent shift to digital platforms, more than one-third of treasury and financial professionals have heightened awareness of the growing risks of fraud and cyber-attacks, shows TD Bank's Treasury Management Survey. Heading into 2017, corporate treasury and finance professionals cite protecting assets, securing transactions and cybersecurity as top priorities. TD Bank surveyed more than 350 financial professionals at the 2016 Association of Financial Professionals conference to learn more about their concerns and opportunities.
